alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Carbon; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:03PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Big Horn, north central Carbon and southwestern Yellowstone Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 401 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms over Yellowstone County, including over Billings. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Half inch hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Trained spotter indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Billings, Laurel, Lockwood, Shepherd, Huntley, Billings Heights, Worden, Billings West End, Ballantine and Pryor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Carbon; Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone
